Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= man; ◄ son of Amram (עַמְרָם) and Jochebed (יֹוכֶבֶד) younger brother of Miriam (מִרְיָם) and Aaron (אַהֲרֹן) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) ► leader of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) during exodus

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= person ordained (מלא) and consecrated (קדשׁ) to perform religious services on behalf of others
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= man; ◄ son of Amram (עַמְרָם) and Jochebed (יֹוכֶבֶד) brother of Moses (מֹשֶׁה) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) ► first high priest (כֹּהֵן)

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= the dead body of a human being, ◄ as defined by the life principle that used to animate it; ≈ contact with it causes ritual uncleanness

= action by which humans cause themselves to become contaminated, ◄ as a result unlawful activities or contact with what has been contaminated, ► which often results in their inability to participate in social and religious activities, until this state is reversed through prescribed rituals and procedures
= set of particles marking an object or event as a subset of a larger group which has been singled out from among the rest
a person connected by blood or marriage
= direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine
= direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption
= son of one's father, whether from the same mother or not
= daughter of one's father, whether from the same mother or not; ≈ sometimes associated with affection; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine
= young unmarried woman, who has never been married before, and has never had sex with a man
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

= action by which humans cause themselves to become contaminated, ◄ as a result unlawful activities or contact with what has been contaminated, ► which often results in their inability to participate in social and religious activities, until this state is reversed through prescribed rituals and procedures

= action by which humans cause themselves to become contaminated, ◄ as a result unlawful activities or contact with what has been contaminated, ► which often results in their inability to participate in social and religious activities, until this state is reversed through prescribed rituals and procedures
= person exercising authority over people, animals, or inanimate objects in the role of owner, ruler, or husband
= action by which priests disqualify themselves for religious service ◄ by unlawful behavior
literally: to make bald baldness; hence: = action by which a human being uses a sharp implement to remove the hair on (part of) his scalp, ► as a sign of mourning

= a hairless patch on the head of an animal or human being in a location where hair normally grows; ≈ this can be a natural phenomenon, as on the head of a vulture, but it can also be created by shaving the head as a sign of mourning

= upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities
= one of the sides or corners of an object
= a growth of hair on the chin and lower cheeks of a mature man’s face, ≈ the absence of which is regarded as shameful
= action by which humans cut the hair on all or part of their body
= the physical body of humans and animals, not including the mind and the inner person
= state in which people, objects and places have undergone the rituals that are required to make them fit to be in the presence of God or to be used in his service
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= action by which humans show total disrespect for a process that is considered holy and/or worthy of respect ◄ by words or actions that are not in line with the behavior that is associated with it
literally: name; hence: = the core of one's identity, which reflect the essence of one's being
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= action by which humans offer something to a deity by burning it partially or in its entirety on the altar; considered to have a pleasing aroma
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= causative action by which humans cause other humans or animals to move to a location relatively close to the location in focus
= state in which by which humans or objects have become part of the realm of God and his service ► and therefore no longer accessible to humans unless they have gone through special rituals
= woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not
= woman that sells her body for payment, making of this her profession; ≈ often associated with shame and sinful behavior
= state in which humans are in a state of dishonor or disgrace; ◄ because of one's own or somebody else's actions
= woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not
= causative action by which people are expelled from their dwelling place
= state in which people, objects and places have undergone the rituals that are required to make them fit to be in the presence of God or to be used in his service
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= causative action by where humans cause other humans or objects to be ready to be in the presence of a deity by going through special rituals

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= causative action by which humans cause other humans or animals to move to a location relatively close to the location in focus
= state in which people, objects and places have undergone the rituals that are required to make them fit to be in the presence of God or to be used in his service

= state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= causative action by which humans or deities set apart humans or objects for a particular purpose or activity relating to the service of God, as a result of which they become holy (קָדֹושׁ)
= direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption
= person ordained (מלא) and consecrated (קדשׁ) to perform religious services on behalf of others
= action by which humans bring dishonor on themselves ◄ by unlawful behavior

Node.gloss: to prostitute oneself|to play the prostitute
Node.definition: = action by which humans engage in prostitution; ≈ associated with unfaithfulness

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine
= causative action by which humans or deities bring dishonor on other humans

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.
= person ordained (מלא) and consecrated (קדשׁ) to perform religious services on behalf of others
= state in which a human being or deity has an elevated status, as a result of their authority, rank, wealth, or wisdom
= member of same family, clan, tribe, or ethnic group
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= causative action by which humans cause a liquid to flow from one place to another

= upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

= high quality oil (שֶׁמֶן) ◄ extracted from the fruits of the olive tree during the first pressing; ► used as food, medicine, fuel, perfume (when mixed with spices), and other purposes; also used in various religious rituals; ≈ associated with joy, but also known for its softness, smoothness, and elusiveness
= oil that is used for anointing objects and people

Node.gloss: to ordain|to install in office|to consecrate
Node.definition: literally: to fill (someone's) hands; hence: = causative action by which someone ordains another person to be a priest

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
literally: to fill (someone's) hand; hence: = causative action by which humans ordain other humans to the office of priest or a similar role
= action by which humans put on clothes or ornaments

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
